headline.main: World Briefing | Africa: Sudan: Bush Envoy On Peace Mission

lead_paragraph: President Bush's special envoy for Sudan, former Senator John C. Danforth, said in Khartoum that he would spend the next year trying to end the country's 18-year civil war but would pass the task on to someone else if the government and rebel groups failed to compromise soon. Mr. Danforth toured a refugee camp outside the capital and held meetings with Sudanese leaders and church representatives. Pledging not to ''choose sides,'' he heads to the rebel-held south today. Marc Lacey (NYT)
abstract: Former US Sen John C Danforth, Pres Bush's special envoy for Sudan, says he will spend next year in efforts to settle country's 18-year civil war, but will pass task on to someone else if government and rebel groups fail to compromise soon; photo (S)
